climbs.name: Point of No Return
climbs.fa: Tony Yaniro, Mike Waugh, and Randy Leavitt, January 1978

content.description: A clean, wide, committing offwidth (crux) leads to very well protected undercling exit moves.
content.protection: Six inch cams are nearly tipped out on the offwidth; bring larger cams or Big Bros.  Small gear protects the undercling.
content.location: This climb is near the southeast end of Little Hunk, on the north-facing side.  It's a wide offwidth slot, capped by a roof.

content.description: Make some difficult moves into the groove proper and then slither your way upwards using just the groove or the more featured face just to the left. One star out of five.
content.location:
Located between

The Cheez-it

and

Groove Avoidance System

.

climbs.name: Groove Avoidance System
climbs.fa: (TR) Alan Roberts and John Hayward, 1987   Lead: Chris Miller & Jacob Colella, March 2000

content.description: Noted as a TR in the guide, this one now sports 3 modern bolts.  With no stopper moves, just consistent clean climbing, this is a fun one for a hot day.
content.protection: Three bolts, #3 Camalots or similar for anchor.

content.description:
Short, but punchy throughout without a generous rest, this route is an obscure gem in the little visited corridor bisecting the Hunks.  The rock is pristine, except for a little grain towards the top.

With three good bolts and a "standard top out" you shouldn't miss out on the Archer-Friedgen.  Just a few hundred yard from the well traveled

Roofing Company

, this one not only has good climbing, but sets you up to head up The Chair, that odd boulder you've been staring at from the North face of Snicker all these years.
content.protection: Three bolts, purple through yellow Camalots give a great choice for the anchor.
content.location:
Best approached from

SW Face Right (Monkey Business Wall)

.  Circle right around the end of the wall and head up, staying fairly tight to the wall.  This route is located at the base of a struggling tree.

climbs.name: The Cheez-it
climbs.fa: Dave Wonderly, Don WIlson, Jennifer Richards, and Karen WIlson. March 1991

content.description: This short route has interesting climbing through some huecos.  Unfortunately the state of the two bolts don't recommend themselves to the lead.
content.protection: Two poor bolts, a finger size piece for the lead, various hand size for the anchor.
content.location: Easy descent to the climbers right.
